Welcome to MLTSA’s documentation!¶

MLTSA is a python-based package which enables users to apply the Machine Learning Transition State Analysis from https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.09.08.459492 to any given data with an array of ML models, as well as generating an analytical model on demand for detecting relevant features in a dataset.

Contents:

  • Analytical One-Dimensional model module
  • Scikit-Learn Integrated MLTSA module

MLTSA¶

Info¶

This is a Python module to apply the MLTSA approach for relevant CV identification on Molecular Dynamics data using both Sklearn and TensorFlow modules.

>examples : Contains files with the easy to call 1D/2D/MD examples to generate data or play around with it as tests for the approach.

> MLTSA_sklearn : Contains the Scikit-Learn integrated functions to apply MLTSA on data.

> MLTSA_tensorflow: Contains the set of functions and different models built on TensorFlow to apply MLTSA on data.

Usage¶

To use MLTSA, first install it using pip:

(.venv) $ pip install MLTSA

MLTSA_examples

Note

This project is under active development, do not expect a stable version, code is provided as is.
